Quote: Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: A human being is spirit. But what is spirit? Spirit is the self. But what is the self? The self is a relation that relates itself to itself or is the relation's relating itself to itself in the relation; the self is not the relation but is the relation's relating itself to itself.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: But there is another sense of the word, of which the fundamental meaning is this: Man is all the time outside of himself.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: The proof that the little prince existed is that he was charming, that he laughed, and that he was looking for a sheep. If anybody wants a sheep, that is a proof that he exists.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: I realize today that nothing in the world is more distasteful to a man than to take the path that leads to himself.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: This very heart which is mine will forever remain indefinable to me. Between the certainty I have of my existence and the content I try to give to that assurance, the gap will never be filled. Forever I shall be a stranger to myself.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Existence is illusory and it is eternal.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: If you've come into this busy world, live your life and leave.
Author: Sigizmund Krzhizhanovsky

Quote: An equilibrium of self and not-self can never be permanently achieved. It can only be faithfully tended created and decreated—and in this work there can be no rest.
Author: Tim Carpenter

Quote: Our sense of death is constructed of the things we make from life.
Author: Tim Carpenter

Quote: Being is thus richly, marvelously improbable. And slight. Contingency is the condition not just of our limited human lives, but of the entirety of the universe.
Author: Tim Carpenter

Quote: Form is thus the essence of art. Just as form-making is the fundamental activity of us meaning-hungry creatures.
Author: Tim Carpenter

Quote: Memory is the substance of all thought. Anticipation and its gropings, desire, planning, the projection of our hopes, our fears, are the main interior activity of our being.
Author: Tim Carpenter

Quote: Nor can we rely on the self—it is truly unreal, nothing but an incalculable tumult of neural activity, pitched and patched together, a chimera of the brain.
Author: Tim Carpenter

Quote: I am not strange to myself and at the same time I am new and
Author: Anne de Marcken

Quote: I say again, out of the sheer joy of being alive: salvation comes through risk—without that, life is not worth living!
Author: Clarice Lispector

Quote: Only the living seem incoherent. Death closes the series of events that constitutes their lives. So we resign ourselves to finding a meaning for them. To refuse them this would amount to accepting that a life, and thus life itself, is absurd.
Author: Édouard Levé

Quote: And Rieux...found it right that at least from time to time, joy should come to reward those who contented themselves with humanity and its poor and terrible love.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: All being arises from nonbeing, and everything that exists derive from its opposite.
Author: Bohumil Hrabal

Quote: Next time is next time, now is now.
Author: Wim Wenders

Quote: He removes his glasses to beam at the past while managing the lenses of the present.
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quote: Nothing in the world is usual today. This is the first morning
Author: Izumi Shikibu

Quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: After all, it's only natural that people are born, love each other, and die.
Author: Yukio Mishima

Quote: He is always becoming, and if it were not for the contingency of death, he would never end.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: After all, what can we ever gain in forever looking back and blaming ourselves if our lives have not turned out quite as we might have wished?
Author: Kazuo Ishiguro

Quote: There is no delusion more damaging than to get the idea in your head that you understand the functioning of your own brain.
Author: Lewis Thomas

Quote: While we're actually suffering, our human pain seems infinite. But human pain isn't infinite, because nothing human is infinite.
Author: Fernando Pessoa
